website_summaries.verdict: A well-made grinder with a few attractive features and a reasonable price.
cons: The grinder is exceptionally large and quite loud

customer_reviews.title: Ok for very light duty
customer_reviews.text: Read woodyq review. I bought this 7 months ago. I've used it MAYBE for an hr runtime as I have 3 other grinders. I don't change types of wheels (cut,grind,wire, flapper) between them because it's annoying. This has always had a cut off wheel...maybe the least taxing of the choices. Picked it up tonight, used it for about 10 minutes...got super hot and started smoking. I'm going to run it until it fries, as there is 3 year warranty and I'm sure they won't replace it on my word alone. Besides that, ergonomics suck, cord is too short, and it gets really hot very quickly. I've had my one Milwaukee for over ten years of heavy use. Still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Get's the Job Done With No Hint of Refinement
customer_reviews.text: I seldom use this grinder, so I don't need anything fancy, but when I need it it saves me a lot of time. Likes: Changing disks is easy, as is adjusting the disk guard. There is an 90-degree handle included, but I haven't used it. The switch took a bit of getting used to as it initially seems to be momentary only, but move it to its small detent and it will stay "on". Dislikes: It has the worst gear lash, aka, backlash, of any power tool I own. As a result, it is loud and vibrates a lot. But hey, I didn't pay a refined price and it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this grinder when i was deployed to Kuwait in 2017. I was in an Air Force construction unit and I could amazon prime one faster than the unit could get one. We beat the heck out of this thing for like 4 months and left it for the next crew to use. we were grinding and cutting concrete and rebar in the desert and it worked perfect the whole time. My buddy ended up buying himself one because he was impressed at how well it did for the cheap price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It died in its first 10 minutes of use. ...
customer_reviews.text: It died in its first 10 minutes of use. Part of me thinks I did something wrong.. but I was only cutting fiberglass reinforced plastic with a cuttoff disk. Update: Took it apart because porter-cable said the only way to get it fixed/replaced was to send it to st louis at my own cost. The price to ship would be half the price of the unit. It appears the failing part was one of the brush boxes. The screw was most likely over-tightened as it broke free at the tab that screws it to the body. I will be ordering a brush box and brushes to get the grinder back to working.
customer_reviews.author: KrAzE

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this grinder in my shop for over a year now. Weekly use, probably a few hours at a time. It gets hot and sounds like its going to blow up, but it just keeps chugging. A coworker has the same grinder and he leaves it out for anybody to use, so it gets abused. And it is still going strong. It's not a $400 metabo. But it's the best value below $100. I definitley recommend this product for medium duty use. Update Jan 2018: Still love it, can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Fit with Damo Shroud for Concrete Grinding
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to use this right angle grinder with a Metal 5 inch dust shroud for cup wheels by Damo, and a concrete grinding disc. What I'm finding is that the cutting surface of the grinding disc is just a hair lower then the lower surface of the shroud, meaning that it might cut for a little while, but when the disc wears out a little bit, there will be no more cutting action.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thorp

customer_reviews.title: 3 years / 3 times used / dead
customer_reviews.text: Hi guys, I bought this thing in 08/2016, I only used it about 3 times 1) cut steel rebar 2016 2) cut steel rebar 2019 3) grind concrete 2020 - > Dead after 20 minutes of work ! I'm not sure what to tell anymore, is this thing programmed to break after 3 uses ???
customer_reviews.author: The Wiz

customer_reviews.title: ... received this metal cutter today and could not be happier. I also purchased some metal cutting disks which ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this metal cutter today and could not be happier. I also purchased some metal cutting disks which I will link below. I cut several bolt off level that were in my concrete front porch and cut other pieces of metal flush with concrete that were front an old porch. 5 Stars! Metal Cutting Disks:
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Less than 3 years of side work and both dead.
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good but less than 3 years later, both are dead. I bought 2 of them at same time so I didn't have to switch wheels so much. Two and half years in the gears in the 1st one broke, few months later the 2nds motor quit. Hoping I can put the 2 together and get one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Dyer

customer_reviews.title: After I received the replacement it became apparent that the guards are annoying in that they hinder getting work done quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this then realized I could spend a few bucks more to get the included cutting guard,  After I received the replacement it became apparent that the guards are annoying in that they hinder getting work done quickly. I had to adjust the guard when working with multiple angles. In the end I just stopped using the guards.
customer_reviews.author: Kamisake

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought two of these. They are not heavy duty, but they are nice and light and cheap enough that you can have one set up with a wire cup for cleaning metal, another with a cut off wheel and an third with a grinding disk. So even if your a hobby welder you can have multiple grinders just like the big boys!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Power Tool for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: This tool came very well packaged, It really is pretty easy to use. Just make sure you practice safety first. I had a small job of cutting a piece of solid steel and I did it in less than a minute. At first I had to make a few adjustments because when I first turned it on sparks were flying all over. It was grinding against the guard. Once I took care of that, all was good. I plan to use it on many other projects that come up in the future. Great power tool!!! Can't beat the price too!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Barretto

customer_reviews.title: Both Caught FIRE
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this grinder and it ran great for a couple of months, then one day about 5 minutes into using it, it started to sound different. Next thing I know it smells like an electric fire and smoke is coming out of it. This is the second time this exact issue has happened to me with this model. Cannot get any help to get it replaced. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: MomRN

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk!!! I finally got to the point in my project today that I needed to use this tool. Got all set up and ready, plugged it in and turned it on...it ran for maybe 20-30 seconds before it stopped dead and smoke is still pouring out of it. I hadn't even started cutting anything...just turning it on was enough to kill it. What a waste of money!!! Now here I sit with a nearly completed project and I can't do anything until I buy another tool. I'm completely disgusted...not sure if this company is just making junk tools, or if this seller is selling junk.
customer_reviews.author: Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that at $25 this grinder is a steal. The grinder comes without a case. It has a handle that could be used either left/right handed. The grinder also arrived with one grinding disk. Over all, the grinder is a steal for the prize.
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: The guard needs attention
customer_reviews.text: Great little inexpensive grinder with one fixable flaw. The flaw is in the guard. It will not let you use a flat cut off or grinding wheel. But, like another reviewer suggested I took a hammer to it. I removed the guard and held it with the clamp up. With a three pound hammer I let it fall squarely on the center of the clamp about five times and that was all it took to reshape the guard so that a flat wheel will work. The guard reshaped fine without looking deformed.
customer_reviews.author: Dragontamerz

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder
customer_reviews.text: Grinder appears well built. Great product at the present selling price of $30. I previously owned a Dewalt, Milwaukee, Skill, Black and Decker and Hitachi grinders. The quality of the Porter Cable is a bit higher than Skill, and Black and Decker. The Dewalt and Milwaukee is a bit better constructed and has support to obtain any spare parts. The Hitachi is of the worst quality although it cost more.
customer_reviews.author: kai

customer_reviews.title: Really good value given it's performance and utility
customer_reviews.text: Really good value given it's performance and utility. For periodic, casual homeowner use, it's perfect. Four stars vs. five was given because the "on-off" sliding switch could be a little smoother and the guard that came with it does not support cut-off wheels. It required minor modification for use with a cut-off wheel and now works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Wester

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box failure
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box doesn't work. Going to attempt to return it. We'll see how that goes... Well out of the 30 day window to return to amazon by 10 days lesson learned try it the day its delivered. Obviously Porter Cable has an issue with cheap switches as i believe this is the problem. Second lesson learned you get what you pay for.......
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase. Great power.
customer_reviews.text: Got to put this to use a while back while changing the rear shackle on my truck. I had to take the guard off to put a cut off wheel on it because I couldn't get the cover I needed right away. I will be purchasing the correct guard though and highly suggest it if you are using it to grind. Had awesome power and worked perfectly. I think they should make it easier to find the guard needed though.
customer_reviews.author: ZumaKyle

customer_reviews.title: Bearing (or bushing?) failed. Shaft wobbles.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great while it lasted. Plenty of power, easy to hold on to and did the jobs. HOWEVER, after 3 years of occasional use, the upper shaft bearing wore sufficiently that the gears failed to engage consistently, bringing the wheel to an abrupt halt, making it now virtually useless. Repair parts are not available - or at least have not been found after diligent searching.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: 1 tiny issue, but well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Overall the machine is good and powerful. Stays reasonably cool during long usage. The only issue is when using a cutoff wheel, the guard has to be removed which isn't a big deal considering that the guard's tool free design, but you just need to be more careful when in using a cutoff wheel. I would still recommend this product for intermediate level user that is not afraid of removing a safety feature. $9 more and you can have a case and another amp, but I didn't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: It works great, and the ability to turn the guard gives ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a chance to use this after having bought it months ago. I used it to grind a corner off the inside of my front bumper so my new oversize tires would stop rubbing when I turn the wheel. It works great, and the ability to turn the guard gives you a lot of flexibility for where/how you work.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend getting 1/16 slicing disc's to go with this
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased more than 6 angle grinders in the last few years and they are a must have tool for any fabricator/welder, I have three of this model. They are fairly light weight and durable. I highly recommend getting 1/16 slicing disc's to go with this, you will never use your torch to cut again. I am taking one star off because I did have one of these come that broke within the first few minutes, however Amazon made it right.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Grinder Received with Defective Guard- Replacement provided by Porter Cable Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This angle gender is a good value, but I discovered a flaw in the guard included with the tool received from Amazon.com. The guard is asymmetrical and causes grinding discs with a hub to contact one side of the guard, making it impossible to use a thick grinding disc or a flap disc. This limited using the grinder with only a thin grinding disc or a cup brush. Update: I contacted Porter Cable directly and they provided me with a replacement guard needed to make full use of this tool's potential. So, I increased the rating from two stars, to four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline S.

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful, great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is one nice grinder. Solid and powerful. I needed a grinder to do some umm Grinding . But all the local box stores had cheap junk, I came across this on Amazon and wow for under $30.00 you can't go wrong it has a nice long cord which I appreciate and is a simply key lock setup. You can feel the power of this bad boy it will get your work done and then some. A year later works great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this toy/tool is fun!
customer_reviews.text: Gosh, I remember using my dad's 4 1/2" angle grinder, but my budget has been so tight over the years. I really never had the money to purchase much of anything...just pay the bills...and wait another week, for my next paycheck. I've been saving pennies, nickels, and other spare change for months now, and just bought this. Wow, this toy/tool is fun!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Benoit

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: Not as powerful as the ones we got in the 80's but still a good buy and powerful enough to do everything I need done now that I'm retired. It is a good buy as most are even less powerful than this one that you get now days. I can't tell a difference for what I use it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Gayron Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for the garage.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grinder, excellent price. This thing has gobs of power per dollar. Cutting and grinding is a snap, I've cut through 3/8 steel with this thing no problem. Nice adjustable handle, nice quick-release shield (for...adjusting the shield). Arbor and chuck spin on and off very easily for quick disc changes. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Z

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, dude. Serious tool here.
customer_reviews.text: It's nuts that you don't need some kind of license to operate this tool. It's like thirty bucks, but it's a seriously powerful tool. I used it to cut bricks (with a masonry blade, sold separately). This was the first time I operated a tool and had the thought that I could hurt myself if I'm not extremely careful. And I've been using power tools since I was a kid on my dad's job sites. Seriously, this is a great tool, especially for the money. But if you're John Q. DoItYourself, don't buy this tool. You're going to hurt yourself. Hire somebody to do whatever you're trying to do.
customer_reviews.author: sad_perfessor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing is amazing. It has plenty of power and i've been beating on this guy pretty hard and still performs like new. If you plan to use thin metal cutoff wheels, this may not be the grinder for you as such discs will not work with the blade shroud in place. But this thing has handled everything i can throw at it from metal to masonry to cutting through reinforced slabs.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a weekend warrior!
customer_reviews.text: Hesitated to buy this compared to a 7.5 amp model, but I will say this thing has plenty of power. If I was a pro fabricator I would have invested in a heavier duty version but for something to have on hand that I might use a handful of times per years its worth every penny to have.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Postma

customer_reviews.title: Two unique features...
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder for the price! It has a couple features I hadn't seen before -- the adjustable guard almost makes you want to leave it on! There is also a third attachment point for the handle that goes straight up. I own a small ornamental iron company, and we probably have 15 grinders floating around. My guys are easy on them but things wear out, and I'll definitely buy more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder for $30
customer_reviews.text: Great little grinder for $30! I used it every day while I was in welding school, and it never let me down. The other students liked the angle of the handle better than the DeWalt's or the Bosch's. I used it as a grinder and a cutting tool and it worked flawlessly. Even used dogs on it t-joints on pipe. There is a part that did come apart under the blade guard, but hasn't affected the performance. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shane T. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Not a great deal but not a bad deal
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I think I could have bought a Ryobi at the Big Box for the same price. The look to have the exact same build and thus quality. The other brand wouldn't have the guard headache this one has. As another reviewer noted I'll just pound the guard down a little bit so cut off disks work too.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.text: Screw mounting of side handle stripped within 30 minutes of starting first use. I noticed the handle would not stay tight immediately. The issue appears to be soft metal used in both bolt and mount. If I held the handle it loosened. When I didn't use the hande it fell off. I wanted an inexpensive grinder to try out but this is not good. It may even be dangerous. Motor ran well. Power was good.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Grinder guard came bent. Had to play with it a bunch to get it to have proper clearance from the grinder. Did not come with the cutoff guard as shown. Very disappointed, but then again, for that price, i should have know what to expect. Needed the tool immediately, so I did the best I could to fix it myself. Not a trigger controlled power tool.
customer_reviews.author: J23

customer_reviews.title: I am sure it will be great as I have several other Porter Cable tools
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to use it as of yet, I am sure it will be great as I have several other Porter Cable tools, I just wish that it was not made in China, although I also have a DeWalt 4 1/2 grinder and I am pretty sure it is also made in China
customer_reviews.author: crowlakeal

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and comfortable to use but my arbor lock button broke the ...
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and comfortable to use but my arbor lock button broke the second day I used it trying to change the disk. The best feature is you can lock it in the on position and rest your grip while doing long tasks like buffing a large area
customer_reviews.author: Crankshaft

customer_reviews.title: Now I Grind Everything
customer_reviews.text: Wow this was a great purchase. Now I grind everything. Haha. I don't want to think too much about that ... it just sounds funny. Porter Cable is still a great name for power tools. I had to grind New Jersey off my SUV's running boards. Worked great. Fast. Threw lots of sparks. Made me happy. Didn't burn anybody nor burn anything down is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder for the price. I use it for woodworking, carving and sanding and it works great. The switch on this grinder is much better then the Makita one that I bought. I like the Makita grinder, but the switch fills with saw dust and it makes the switch stick. This one does not seem to have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: No vibration with the included grinding disc. I wish it came with cutting disk, but they're 10$ for a 10 pack at harbor freight so I got over it pretty quick. The one thing I don't care for is the lock-on system for the switch. I feel like I have to be more careful than i would have to with a trigger switch. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Prosky

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit
customer_reviews.text: Great unit for the $$$. Price is close to what TSC will sell it for and at times it's cheaper at TSC. But I used it to sand clapboard siding on a house and the unit has ran great for a 10' high 40' long old house. I have never been disappointed with PC product.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: An excellent deal!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and for the price it makes a great compliment to my Bosch angle grinder. Now I can leave one set up with a cutting disc and one with a sanding disc. No time wasted switching back and forth with one grinder. I have used this Porter-Cable for many hours now and it is great. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: JagLite

customer_reviews.title: I've always had good luck with porter cable
customer_reviews.text: I've always had good luck with porter cable, until I bought this. I used it on two jobs. The first time it started to smell and act like it was getting too hot after only a few minutes. The second time, it burned up in about five minutes. It could have just been a lemon but I will not try it again
customer_reviews.author: rrrrrrrrrr

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a one time job. Modified the guard with a hammer so my blade would fit. Worked like a charm. I've thought up several jobs for it now. It cut my pavers with no issues. Nice heavy machine. #2 This thing is a hog. It cut a hole in a brick wall for a crawl space door. Work like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: glen c roberts jr

customer_reviews.title: Bad vibration
customer_reviews.text: It vibrates so bad my hand goes numb. Even without a grinding wheel on it it vibrates too much.
customer_reviews.author: Zee zee

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's suppose to, at a value price
customer_reviews.text: There isn't really much to say, this is a small electric grinder that does exactly what it is suppose to do...grind. I bought it for the price since I cannot say I grind anything on a daily bases....hmmm, not even monthly to think about it. But for the DIY handyman, it is a great little tool to have around the house. I have found myself using it more than I expected. Anyway, for the money and power, plus Porter-Cable makes quality tools, I think its a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Nowhere Man

customer_reviews.title: I didn't realize how much fun It would be
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and although I did my research prior to purchasing it, I didn't realize how much fun It would be. I've used it to make a metal smoker/grill, cut metal barrels in half to make my wife her planters etc. Its been a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for occasional home use
customer_reviews.text: This is my first angle grinder, and it's worth every penny of ~$30. I bought it because I had some rebar sticking out of concrete on my back patio. it cut easily through the rebar (with lots of sparks, so safety gear was needed), and then smoothed out the surface of the rebar so that it was flush with the concrete. It took less than 20 minutes to cut and grind down 6x 1/2-inch rebar stubs.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a solidly constructed unit
customer_reviews.text: A bit on the heavy side, as I'd expect all angle grinders to be, but it's not quite as noisy as my previous Ryobi. Great price for a solidly constructed unit, so it gets five stars. Seems well balanced. I wonder why these things don't come in multiple speeds, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE!
customer_reviews.text: Cord began to short out during first use and got worse after more usage. I have to hold the cord against the handle to keep it from shorting out as much; still does though. Waste of money for me! Update: My apologies! I discovered that the "short out" was caused by an extension cord I was using with the grinder. Runs perfectly when plugged directly into the wall.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: Good tool to get those really tuff toenails trimmed. Really, so far it's been very good. Have used it many times.
customer_reviews.author: yowmon

customer_reviews.title: Tough little grinder.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder in 2017 for a small project. I ended up putting many many hours on it through several larger projects after that. It finally died today. Armature burnt out. I can’t complain. More than got my money’s worth of work out of it. If you’re a contractor maybe look at a more expensive one, but for casual use this thing will last you forever.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: name brand tool for cheap-I like that!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how inexpensive this was! very happy to have a tool to cut pipe. I'm tired of breaking sawzall blades--this guy really works, even on larger galvanized pipe. I broke seven blades trying to cut through a 3" metal pipe. this guy used up one disc. very happy with purchase, and PC is a good solid brand.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M. Racey

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: Have used it to remove paint with a wire wheel, clean steel with a grinding wheel, and cut steel with a cutting wheel. No problems whatsoever. Great value in a grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Sooner613

customer_reviews.title: Recognizable name brand and a cost you cannot beat.
customer_reviews.text: Great feel, low cost. Recognizable name brand and a cost you cannot beat. Not the top end, but better than comparably priced units. Perfect for the home garage and for odd jobs. Capable of working an entire day and performs well. Does not bog down and no reason to believe it will give up anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: RD2000

customer_reviews.title: Got this on a daily deal. Can't be beat ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this on a daily deal. Can't be beat for the sale price. It works well for me but I don't use it every day either.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder better price!
customer_reviews.text: For 30 greenbacks this little grinder is awesome, it's hefty and well built and a deal for the price. Able to keep three of these, one with a wheel, one with a cut off disc and one with a cupped wire brush. It not only saves time having but spreads the load out so no one tool is doing all the work all the time.
customer_reviews.author: WARezDOG

customer_reviews.title: Picked this up as a second one to have on ...
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up as a second one to have on hand and thus far it's held up it's end of the bargain. As a homeowner I don't use it nearly as consistently as a mechanic or other craftsman, but I have no complaints. It's done everything I've asked it to and if the price is right I'd pick up another Porter Cable in the future.
customer_reviews.author: North Land

customer_reviews.title: Good tool but read my warning about which to buy
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder - I have been cutting bricks and stone with it - BUT - if you plan on using the stone cutting wheel with it but the slightly more expensive one that comes WITH the guard (Porter Cable 5140099-07 GUARD) for the stone wheel. Buying it separately later will cost you nearly what you pay for the grinder alone....
customer_reviews.author: Mark Glidden

customer_reviews.title: great tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to cut off 50 pieces of steel welded to a trailer deck. Its been operating very smoothly and hasn't missed a beat. Great price and quality seems great!!!!! The only downfall is cant use guard with cut off wheel because it rubs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Either poor quality or I got a defective one...
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok at first then it died. It wasn't a very expensive grinder but usually Porter Cable holds up better. Must not be what it used to... I barely used this thing at all before it croaked I cut a few porcelain tile and that was it. Probably burnt brushes...
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: A good tool at a good price....
customer_reviews.text: I got this for sharpening lawn mower blades. It comes with a grinding wheel in the box that worked perfect for the task. Sharped a dull blade to a sharp edge in about 10 seconds. A great tool. I also have a Porter-Cable drill and a dual action polisher. I was happy with both of those so I went with Porter-Cable again for this tool and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: A good machine, I've been using it for hours at ...
customer_reviews.text: A good machine, I've been using it for hours at a time removing paint. Well, it's only been 9 months since I bought it and it just died today. It was used many hours for the first few months but a bearing just blew out. Porter Cable used to be good solid American made tools, but the last few I've owned have been anything but.
customer_reviews.author: Barium5

customer_reviews.title: This works just fine to make 7 cuts in my 55 gallon drum ...
customer_reviews.text: This works just fine to make 7 cuts in my 55 gallon drum to make a vortex burn barrel. The motor runs as great as imaginable. It seems like the reason so many people choose this one is quality and reputation, but this was least expensive choice, too. I buy quality, not cheap, but this is great.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: I used this thing like 3 times and on the third time the motor ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this thing like 3 times and on the third time the motor went out on me and it does not work. I have tried a bunch of things to get it working again, but it is just dead. I need to figure out how to return this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Seems good. Powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: Seems good. Powerful enough. Crazy cheap. One note is that you must use 7/8 discs. The 5/8 arbor is for screw on accessories only. Even though the amazon listing shows that people also bought the 5/8 Dewalt discs, they cannot be used with this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: phootbag

customer_reviews.title: Best $30 I ever spent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with a dewalt diamond blade to cut through some masonry retaining wall blocks for a wall I was building. I was able to make precise cuts like a hot knife through butter. I will definitely have more projects that I will look forward to getting good use out of this with.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Hodgen

customer_reviews.title: GETS THE WORK DONE
customer_reviews.text: This little guy gets the work done. A little noisy for my taste, though. Feels a lot louder than my Makita. Love it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: 5" grinding wheel for concrete - flat wheels foul on the finger-guard
customer_reviews.text: Does not accept a standard flat 4.5" grinding wheel for concrete - flat wheels foul on the finger-guard. Don't ever use any angle grinder without a finger guard, folks.
customer_reviews.author: PenNameHere

customer_reviews.title: Broken spindle stop after short period of time.
customer_reviews.text: The button to lock the spindle in order to remove the tool broke after about 2 weeks. Opened it up and looks like the stop sheared off where it engages the spiral gear. Pretty poor quality. Very disappointed. If I wanted something that would only last two weeks I would have bought a HF grinder.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Used it a little and like it much better than cheaper alternatives.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this a ton but it seems much nicer than the harbor freight ones I've been using. Feels like it's better built and I like the multiple possibilities for the handle position. Turns on and off easily and just seems of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and fair price
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat Porter Cable for quality and value. Grandpa used these tools when I were 12 years old. Plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyD

customer_reviews.title: great angle grinder for the money
customer_reviews.text: great angle grinder for the money. Used it on a bathroom renovation and used it with a bosch diamond tile cutting blade to cut stone tiles. It made short work of the stone, and did not overheat. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: does'nt work well with thin cut off wheels..improper guard depth offset
customer_reviews.text: works good but the guard is a little too shallow for using the thin cutting wheels...they rub on the guard. it should be offset 1/8" deeper to eliminate that issue
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: as a good grinder to have handy in my shop for occasional ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for it's name brand, as a good grinder to have handy in my shop for occasional use, but it only lasted 3 or 4 times, for about 2 minutes each time. I will see how well they stand behind their 3 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Box picture did not match contents.
customer_reviews.text: the handle had been swapped out for a much cheaper one then the box shows and it did not come with a key to be able to change the grinding blade out like the picture on the box shows it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a secondary grinder to keep a flap disc on. Works great for the price. A lot more gear noise and whine then my bosch, but it was also 1/4 the price!
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it already
customer_reviews.text: I really like this grinder. Ive been working it very hard and it's kept up. The only thing is if you use a flat cutting disk it will cut into the gaurd. Use cutting disks that have an offset to them works better. Definitely recommend. .
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: It's best product for the price. Does not have variable speed so it's very fast all the time. I don't mind that though so just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Had to stop and let the grinder cool several times. Did get the job done. Good product for be price.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Kuehn

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price
customer_reviews.text: A lot stronger and heaver than my old cheap grinder from flea market lot more power good price only problem was when I put on cutting wheel sparks would fly from hitting the guard was able to move it around enough to stop the sparks, but it is close.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I wore out a cheap angle grinder from H***** F**** using it to sharpen the blades on a brush mower about 15 times. This grinder has more power, more than double the quality, and has spare parts available. I can see it will be in my shop for a long while.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Gteat buy.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it came with the cut off guard but I still use the cut off wheels anyways, just flip the nut over. Just make sure to wear goggles. I don't see why anyone would buy a more expensive brand. I've yet to have a Porter cable tool die or break
customer_reviews.author: jacob britton

customer_reviews.title: Years of use, still running strong!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t be the price and quality of Porter Cable! You don’t pay for the name, and I like that. Great quality, have used weekly for years now.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: one dewalt works great but I use it in a jig
customer_reviews.text: I have three 4 1/2 grinders - one made by Chicago needs parts I cannot find, one dewalt works great but I use it in a jig, the porter cable is the best well thought-out grinder,
customer_reviews.author: Sgt. Badger

customer_reviews.title: Good Power
customer_reviews.text: Works great has lots of power is my second one , brother took my first one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and we very pleased! Works with DeWalt 4" blades with 5/8" center ...
customer_reviews.text: My jack-of-all-trades husband jumped at the chance to get this, because he knew of it's reputation. He used it yesterday for the first time, and we very pleased! Works with DeWalt 4" blades with 5/8" center hole (can't remember what you call it). Good price, as well.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: needs separate blade gaurd for some discs
customer_reviews.text: gaurd that comes with tool works well with flat discs, but to use discs with a concave profile you must purchase a different blade guard. no other angle grinder that i know of requires 2 separate guards to use a full range of discs. beware. otherwise the tool works great.
customer_reviews.author: aaron maret

customer_reviews.title: I put this tool to work
customer_reviews.text: I like owning this tool over the years. Very helpful and time saving, used it with a cutting wheel as a last resort to take out a shock for my truck
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Windisch

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to sharpen lawn mower blades, I run a lawn service, it does the job. Update : 2018 still running great
customer_reviews.author: D. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 2 ain't bad!
customer_reviews.text: Good thing I bought 2! The first one worked for about 30 seconds before the gears stripped internally.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Side handle like a Glock, otherwise good quality
customer_reviews.text: It is good quality grinder. I took the wheel cover off so I could use a cutoff wheel. It works fine just keep your face out of sparks and wear glasses. The only negative I have with it is that the side handle is at a bad angle, kind of like a Glock. It is well made and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: cep89

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: For the money it works well...I used it to cut aluminum sheets...would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Dan Casey

customer_reviews.title: 🎄
customer_reviews.text: Great power and fits wheels easily. The con is there's no high and low its one speed. Would work on more applications lnn
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't all there
customer_reviews.text: The grinder work well, but the locking wrench was missing. It arrived in a timely manner, and I was able to fasten a grinding wheel to the grinder, but the right wrench would have made it more secure.
customer_reviews.author: William Corpora

customer_reviews.title: I rarely give 5 stars, but I tortured this ...
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give 5 stars, but I tortured this tool on a heavy grinding job right out of the box. I burnt up 2 grinders and stripped the gearhead out of another on lesser jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful, we'll built tool. For $30 I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful, we'll built tool. For $30 I don't think you can really beat this grinder. Plenty of power. My one qualm with it is it is defendingly loud compared to other grinders I have used (even when not contacting a surface) .
customer_reviews.author: Colin Caruso

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE AND STRONG
customer_reviews.text: THIS GRINDER IS THE REAL DEAL, WORKS GREAT JUST BE CAREFUL OF THE SWITCH. MAYBE THEY COULD CHANGE IT TO BE BETTER BUT FOR THE MONEY ITS GREAT TURN IT ON AND IT STAYS ON. SO BE CAREFULL IF YOU DROP IT , IT WILL NOT TURN OFF ON ITS ON
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H.

product_meta.title: PORTER-CABLE Angle Grinder, 6.0-Amp, 4-1/2-Inch (PC60TAG)
product_meta.description:
Style:GrinderAMAZON.COM
Porter-Cable's PC60TAG 6.0-amp cut-off tool/angle grinder has a high-performance motor, a user-friendly ergonomic design, and a focus on ease-of-use operating, a combination that makes this an ideal tool for contractors, plumbers, electricians, and anyone looking for a tool to help with grinding and cutting metal, cleaning and finishing surfaces, and tuckpointing. 



Power and Speed in One Package
Porter-Cable's PC60TAG cut-off tool/angle grinder has a serious 11,000 rpms to take care of a wide array of high-speed material removal tasks, while the rugged 6-amp motor plows through a variety of jobs without any problems. The grinder's 3-position side handle in combination with a rotating housing feature lets the gear housing circumvolve for optimal positioning for the task at hand and helps to ensure that a user will retain control in whatever position they're using the tool. 
A Host of Helpful Features
A durable cast metal gear case on Porter-Cable's PC60TAG cut-off tool/angle grinder adds both to the life of the tool and to its resilience around the workplace. The tool-free rapid release guard makes it possible to have quick and simple guard removal and to align the guard to control the spark path in the proper way and provide an extra safety feature. The guard also adds to the time-saving this tool provides. The spindle lock feature, which allows a user to have single wrench bit changes, also saves time on the jobsite, while the comfortable grip areas and light weight of the tool help to lessen the chance of user fatigue. 

Dimensions & Warranty
Porter-Cable's PC60TAG cut-off tool/angle grinder weighs 4.1 pounds. It comes with a 3-year limited warranty, a 1-year free service contract, and a 90 day money back guarantee. 

About Porter-Cable
At the forefront of technological advances for over 95 years, Porter-Cable has introduced such noteworthy products as the world's first portable belt sander in 1926 and the first right-hand, helical-gear circular saw in 1929. This passion for progress flows through every product Porter-Cable offers. Their product line is the result of a dedicated team of researchers and engineers listening to what tool users have to say, constantly looking for ways to improve existing tools and dream up new ones. The company designs, manufactures and distributes electric and cordless power tools, pneumatic tools and compressors, pressure washers, generators and related accessories for the professional woodworking, commercial/residential construction, plumbing and electrical markets. 

What's in the Box
One PC60TAG cut-off tool/angle grinder, side handle, grinding wheel, wrench, blade guard.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Porter-Cable PC1500HGA Heat Gun has a dual fan speed selector that delivers high and low fan speed settings. The variable temperature control dial allows for easy adjustment of temperatures. It has an integrated hands free support stand that allows the gun to sit upright for hands free use. The integrated hanging hook is ideal for storage. The lightweight, only 2-Pound, gun offers less fatigue when holding. It has a 1500-Watt motor that delivers high heat and multiple fan settings. Its 6-Feet high grade cord improves flexibility during cold use. Perfect for applications such as: Paint removal, Bending plastic pipes, welding plastics, Removing adhesive tiles, Shrinking plastic tubing.
feature_bullets: 11000 rpm for high speed material removal
Durable 6 A motor powers through jobsite tasks with ease
Cast metal gear case increases jobsite durability and tool longevity

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars825 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
